intro: Trichomanes paucisorum, commonly known as the sparse-leaf holly fern, is a rare and delicate fern species native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds with a distinctive, intricate venation pattern. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing soruses, are located on the underside of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
